alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:40PM EST until December 21 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Assabet River At Maynard affecting Middlesex and Worcester Counties. For the Assabet River...including Maynard...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Assabet River at Maynard. * WHEN...From this evening to late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding is likely in low lying sections along the river including portions of Maynard, Hudson and Concord. Water may approach homes along the river and may force several localized road closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM EST Monday was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 5.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.8 feet on 10/22/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1000 AM EST.
